provenance.name: Victoria and Albert Museum
provenance.note: Acquired, and probably commissioned, from Blake by Thomas Butts, c. 1799-1800; by inheritance in 1845 to Thomas Butts, Jr.; sold from his collection, Foster and Son auction, London, 29 June 1853, lot 95 (with lot 94, *The Christ Child Asleep on a Cross*, Butlin 411, for £1 to Sir William Stirling-Maxwell); Gen. Archibald Stirling, probably by inheritance in 1878; Lt.-Col. William Stirling, probably by inheritance in 1931; sold 1953 to the Victoria and Albert Museum.

desc.objtitle: Eve Tempted by the Serpent, Object 1 (Butlin 379)

objnote.p: Blake signed the work, lower left, with his monogram; see the textual transcription. An enhanced image of the monogram has been provided below. The painting was restored by John Hell in 1953-54 and again c. 1980.

illustration.illusobjdesc: This design, which takes its subject from Genesis 3:1-5, is dominated by the figures of Eve—nude with long, curly hair—and a serpent whose body coils around itself at least six times and around Eve's feet once. Eve stands on tiptoe facing forward, with her right arm raised at 135 degrees, palm up, and her left arm raised at 45 degrees, palm down. Her left leg is extended backward slightly. The serpent's crested head faces left and down, with the suggestion of exposed teeth in its smiling(?) mouth. The forbidden fruit and two leaves dangle from the serpent's mouth. It may be looking at Eve's raised right hand. To the left of the end of snake's tail lies Adam, supine though with his lower body turned to face forward. He, like Eve, is nude and has curly hair. Adam lies asleep with his arms at his side and his eyes closed. To the left of Eve is the trunk of a tree, its leafy(?) branches arching into the upper right corner of the design. This tree probably represents the Tree of the Knowledge of Good and Evil. In the background a moon with the crescent in its base presides over a night sky, with scattered clouds. The landscape is covered with indeterminate vegetation. A waterfall and river run to the left of Adam, and there re hills or distant mountains to the right of Eve's left hand. A clump of trees rises above the waterfall.

component.illusobjdesc: The design is dominated by the figures of Eve—nude with long, curly hair—and a serpent whose body coils around itself at least six times and around Eve's feet once. Eve stands on tiptoe facing forward, with her right arm raised at 135 degrees, palm up, and her left arm raised at 45 degrees, palm down. Her left leg is extended backward slightly. Her breasts are clearly pictured.

The design is dominated by the figures of Eve, nude with long, curly hair, and a serpent whose body coils around itself at least six times and around Eve's feet once. The coils suggest, but do not quite create, a spiral that allows it to stand upright to Eve's left. There are at least three spikes or spines, along with the suggestion of wavy hair, beneath the serpent's crest. The serpent's crested head faces left and down, with the suggestion of exposed teeth in its smiling(?) mouth. The forbidden fruit and two leaves dangle from the serpent's mouth. It may be looking at Eve's raised right hand.

To the left of the end of snake's tail lies Adam, supine though with his lower body turned to face forward. He, like Eve, is nude and has curly hair, though his is short. Adam lies with his arms at his side and his eyes closed. He is sleeping.
To the left of Eve is the trunk of a tree, its leafy(?) branches arching into the upper right corner of the design. This tree probably represents the Tree of the Knowledge of Good and Evil.
In the background a moon with the crescent in its base presides over a night sky, with scattered clouds.
The landscape is covered with indeterminate vegetation, possibly grass in the foreground. A clump of trees rises above the waterfall on the right.
A waterfall, just above Adam, empties into a river or lake. There are slight indications of waves in the water. Hills or distant mountains appear behind Eve's lowered left hand.
